programme.title: Main Race - F1 Singapore Grand Prix - 2025
programme.desc: beIN SPORTS is the live and exclusive broadcast partners of Formula 1 until end of 2033 season. The 2025 season has a record schedule of 24 Formula 1 races and all race weekends, including every Practice, Qualifying, Sprint and Race will be live and exclusive on beIN.

programme.title: Brentford vs. Manchester City - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Since completing a Premier League double over Manchester City in 2022-23, Brentford are winless in their last four against the Citizens in the division. Manchester City have only lost one of their four Premier League visits to Brentford, going down 1-0 on the final day of the 2022-23 season.

programme.title: Leeds United vs. Tottenham Hotspur - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Leeds United have lost nine of their last 11 Premier League games against Tottenham Hotspur, including each of their last four in a row – their longest ever league losing run to Spurs. Tottenham have won both of their last two league visits to Elland Road and could beat Leeds United away from home three times running in the league for the very first time.

programme.title: Chelsea vs. Liverpool - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: After their 3-1 win in May, Chelsea could enjoy back-to-back league wins over Liverpool for the first time since November 2014. Liverpool are winless in their last four Premier League games at Stamford Bridge and could lose away to Chelsea two seasons running in the league for the first time since losing three on the bounce from 2004-05 to 2006-07.

programme.title: GP Confidential 2025 Magazine
programme.desc: Explore the sporting secrets of F1. Across 25 episodes and in crisp 3D animations, we analyses the technical details, which decide which teams make the most of the rules - and which need to go back to the drawing board. Complemented by features on historical milestones as well as race previews - GP Confidential is the perfect treat for any F1 fan.

programme.title: North. Ireland vs Germany - UEFA European Qualifiers World Cup 2026 - MD8
programme.desc: Northern Ireland are winless in their last 13 matches against Germany, losing the last 10 in a row. They last beat them back in November 1983 in a European Championship qualifier. Germany have won seven of their nine away matches against Northern Ireland, winning the last five in a row and scoring 15 goals in the process. Their most recent visit was a 2-0 win in September 2019 in a European Championship qualifier.

programme.title: Arturo Coello (ESP) / Agustin Tapia (ARG) vs Federico Chingotto (ARG) / Alejandro Galan (ESP) - Men
programme.desc: Top seeds Arturo Coello/Agustín Tapia clash with No.2 Alejandro Galán/Federico Chingotto. Coello/Tapia dominated most of 2025, but Galán/Chingotto struck back with victory in Germany P2. Head-to-head favors Coello/Tapia, yet momentum is split after recent meetings. Indoor conditions at Rotterdam Ahoy amplify aggressive volleys and x-3 smashes, setting up a high-stakes P1 decider.

programme.title: Delfina Brea Senesi (ARG) / Gemma Triay Pons (ESP) vs Ariana Sanchez Fallada (ESP) / Paula Josemari
programme.desc: World No.1 pairing Gemma Triay/Delfina Brea face No.2 Ariana Sánchez/Paula Josemaría at Rotterdam Ahoy. A classic rivalry: Triay/Brea lead the season with multiple titles, including Germany P2 last week, while Sánchez/Josemaría chase revenge after losing six of seven meetings this year. Expect sharp returns, low volleys, and golden-point pressure in a battle for supremacy.

programme.title: GP Confidential 2025 Magazine
programme.desc: Explore the sporting secrets of F1. Across 25 episodes and in crisp 3D animations, we analyses the technical details, which decide which teams make the most of the rules - and which need to go back to the drawing board. Complemented by features on historical milestones as well as race previews - GP Confidential is the perfect treat for any F1 fan.

programme.title: Race 4 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: The Misano finale. Championship hopefuls chase maximum points as fatigue, tyre life and track limits shape the last attacks. A strong launch, disciplined braking at Quercia and perfect traction from Tramonto decide podiums. Anticipate safety-car drama, photo-finish drafts to the stripe, and decisive moves under pressure as the round closes with a flat-out sprint.

programme.title: Race 5 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: Rising talents go wheel-to-wheel at Misano World Circuit Marco Simoncelli in Race 5. Slipstreams on the main straight and commitment through Curvone shape the order, while track limits, safety cars, and bold restarts can flip everything late. A flat-out sprint where newcomers and title hopefuls fight to the flag.

programme.title: Sprint Race - World Super Bike - Estoril Round 2025
Race 2 - World Super Bike - Estoril Round 2025
programme.desc: WorldSBK heads to Estoril for the weekend’s decisive Race 2. The long front straight and technical infield reward grip and bravery, with braking into Parabolica and the drag to Turn 1 often settling it. Expect drafting trains, tyre-management gambles, and late lunges as title hopes to tighten in a full-throttle finale.

programme.title: Race 1 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: The Misano weekend opens with a sprint that rewards clean starts, tyre warm-up and bravery through Curvone. Expect late dives into Turn 1, heavy braking at Quercia and traction duels out of Tramonto onto the back straight. Safety cars and track-limits calls can flip the order, while newcomers hunt points and title hopefuls set the tone for the round.

programme.title: Race 2 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: Race 2 reshuffles the deck after overnight tweaks. Warmer track temps raise tyre-degradation stakes, making slipstream timing on the main straight vital. Inside lines at Turn 1 and measured exits from Tramonto decide most passes. Watch for undercuts on out-laps, safety-car restarts, and penalties for track limits as contenders bank crucial mid-round points.

programme.title: Race 3 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: With setups refined, Race 3 is often the weekend’s fiercest sprint. Nose-to-tail packs form into Turn 1, while rhythm and patience through the fast right-lefts keep front tyres alive. Curvone commitment and a tidy run to Quercia create overtaking chances. Expect bold moves, defensive elbows, and strategy on push laps to climb

programme.title: Scotland vs Belarus - UEFA European Qualifiers World Cup 2026 - MD8
programme.desc: Scotland have won three of their previous five meetings with Belarus, with each of those coming in World Cup qualifying – the most recent was just last month, with the Scots winning 2-0 in Belarus. This will be Belarus’ third trip to face Scotland, losing the first 4-1 in September 1997 before winning the most recent 1-0 in October 2005.

programme.title: My Faith in Sport - Sawm
programme.desc: Ramadan is a crucial period in the Islamic calendar but fasting (Sawm) can provide complications for athletes who are trying to compete at the highest level. But to what extent is fasting a negative or can it actually aid performance? We look at the life and adaptation throughout Ramadan of Adam Azim – an unbeaten professional boxer from the UK, Fares El Bakh – a weightlifter who won Qatar’s first ever Olympic gold medal, and Zainab Alema – a rugby player who is aiming to become the first player to represent England wearing a hijab. Experts in Sports Science and Nutrition from Aspetar Clinic, Qatar also add detail of the physical impact athletes encounter during Ramadan.

programme.desc: Exploring the importance of prayer within Islam, the episode begins with an overview of our seven athletes as they introduce themselves and why Islam is so important to them. We are also introduced to Omar Sulieman, a notable Imam, who acts as narration throughout the series and a guiding voice on the key principles of Islam. The life and career of Sofyan Amrabat is explored, showcasing his role as a key part of the Fenerbahce team in Turkey and the Moroccan national side. The Atlas Lions’ run to the semi-finals of the FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 is explored, with the impact that Salah played in the team’s belief and positivity throughout the tournament.

programme.title: My Faith in Sport - Taffakur
programme.desc: Islam teaches Muslims about ‘Tawakkul’ meaning trusting in God’s plan. Muslims believe in the idea that with anything in life we put forward our best efforts but ultimately the rest is left to God and believing whatever the outcome, it was pre-written. Omar Marmoush is the feature athlete in the final episode of the series – from the outskirts of the Eintracht Frankfurt side to an $80m move to Premier League Manchester City, his last 18 months has seen an incredible rise. programme.title: DTM Show 2025-Red Bull Ring Part 1
programme.desc: DTM. The embodiment of Motorsport tradition. Having just turned 40, the DTM combines a unique fascination and familiarity with an unmistakable dynamic, signified by the rebranding with a new logo! Seven different manufacturers – ten different winners on six brands (Audi, BMW, Mercedes, Lamborghini, Porsche and Ferrari) through twelve races are but one testament to the unique competitive balance that makes every DTM weekend a revelation! And with the addition of Ford, the palette of different brands is only increasing!

programme.title: M3-ATP 250 - European open 2025 - Brussels
programme.desc: ATP 250 European Open 2025 (10th edition) debuts in Brussels after nine years in Antwerp, staged on indoor-hard courts at Brussels Expo (Palais 12), 13–19 Oct. Draw sizes: 28-player singles / 16-team doubles. Prize money: €706,850. Expect fast, first-strike tennis, sharp returns and tie-break pressure as contenders fight for late-season ranking points and momentum toward Turin.

programme.title: Al Shamal vs Al Gharafa - Qatar Stars League 2025/26 - W5
programme.desc: The Qatari League is the official football league in Qatar. The league includes 12 teams. The most famous participating clubs are Al-Sadd, the champions of the last season; Al-Rayyan and Al-Arabi, the popular teams, Al-Duhail and Al-Gharafa, serious contenders for the title every season. The Qatari league includes star names such as Firmino, Verratti, and Qatari Akram Afif, the best player in Asia.

programme.title: Cesson-Rennes vs Montpellier - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germains 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

The most famous participating clubs are Al-Sadd, the champions of the last season; Al-Rayyan and Al-Arabi, the popular teams, Al-Duhail and Al-Gharafa, serious contenders for the title every season. The Qatari league includes star names such as Firmino, Verratti, and Qatari Akram Afif, the best player in Asia.

programme.title: Nîmes vs Nantes - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germains 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.
